intro: Cheirinia longisiliquosa, commonly known as the long silique cress, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, green, elongated pods called siliques. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces numerous small, round seeds. Cheirinia longisiliquosa is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
